title: Job’s Final Defense of His Integrity
summary: Job reaffirms his innocence and refuses to confess to sins he didn’t commit. He warns that the wicked may seem to prosper but will ultimately face judgment and loss.

faq.question: How does Job respond to his suffering?
faq.answer: By holding fast to his integrity and refusing to lie about wrongdoing.

faq.question: What does Job say about the fate of the wicked?
faq.answer: That their wealth and families will ultimately perish despite temporary success.
